doc:
John C. Rice https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_C._Rice 0 John C. Rice (April 7, 1857, Sullivan County, New York – June 5, 1915, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania) was an American born Broadway stage actor who is credited with performing the first onscreen kiss with May Irwin in 1896 for the Thomas Edison film company film The Kiss. The film was a 47-second recreation of a scene from the Broadway play The Widow Jones starring Irwin and Rice. John_C._Rice ( April_7_,_1857 , Sullivan_County , New_York – June_5_,_1915_,_Philadelphia_,_Pennsylvania ) was an_American_born_Broadway_stage_actor who is_credited with performing the_first_onscreen_kiss with May_Irwin in 1896 for the_Thomas_Edison_film_company_film The Kiss . The_film was a_47-second_recreation of a_scene from the_Broadway_play The_Widow_Jones starring Irwin_and_Rice .
